文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: Zircaloy with fine (∼0.05 μm), uniformly distributed intermetallic precipitates reveals nodular corrosion in steam at 420°C or below and excessive uniform corrosion in water at 350°C, but the best nodular behavior in steam at 500°C
腐蚀数据: nodular corrosion in steam at 420°C or below; excessive uniform corrosion in water at 350°C; best nodular behavior in steam at 500°C

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: samples with larger intermetallic precipitates (>0.2 μm) exhibit a strong tendency to nodular corrosion in 500°C steam, but good behavior in steam at 420°C or below and in water at 350°C
腐蚀数据: strong tendency to nodular corrosion in 500°C steam; good behavior in steam at 420°C or below and in water at 350°C

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: samples exposed up to 1000 days in degassed water and afterwards 1000 days in water with a hydrogen overpressure
腐蚀数据: ranking in uniform corrosion altered by additions of hydrogen

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: Materials with very fine intermetallic precipitates, which show little tendency for nodular corrosion and behave well in-pile in oxygenated (mostly BWR) environments, exhibit accelerated uniform corrosion in a hydrogenated (PWR) environment
腐蚀数据: little tendency for nodular corrosion in oxygenated BWR; accelerated uniform corrosion in hydrogenated PWR

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: materials with coarse precipitates indicate severe nodular corrosion, which is almost independent of the temperatures within the range of 290 and 350°C
额外性质: {"precipitate_size": "coarse", "temperature_independence": "nodular corrosion almost independent of temperature in 290-350°C range"}

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: For optimized BWR cladding tubes ΣAᵢ ≤ 10⁻¹⁸ h is proposed; the best range for PWR cladding appears to be at 2×10⁻¹⁸ h ≤ ΣAᵢ ≤ 5×10⁻¹⁷ h
